result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David S. Dresel

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Cases called at 10:15 AM: 21CM820, 22CF33. Hearing held via Zoom video conferencing.
Defendant David S. Dresel appeared by video.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for David S. Dresel.  District Attorney Peter Rindal appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Thorson requests the Plea Hearing be rescheduled as he has not completed the plea paperwork with the Defendant.
Plea Hearing: 11/17/22 at 10:00 AM.
Plea hearing on October 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.

(Cases called at 2:12 PM - 21CM820 and 22CF33)
Defendant David S. Dresel appeared by video, in custody, from the Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video..  Attorney Afton Lewis appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Offer has been received by Defense; close to an agreement in both cases.  
Plea Hearing: October 13, 2022 at 10:15 AM (via Zoom; Defendant to coordinate with Attorney Thorson on how to appear if/when he is released)
Status conference on September 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

(Cases called at 3:40 PM - 21CM820 and 22CF33)
Defendant David Dressel (does not appear until 3:45 PM) by videoconference from the Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Robert Thorson appears via videoconference.  Attorney Afton Lewis appears for the State of Wisconsin via videoconference. 
Defense indicates that the offer calls for treatment court, but that there is no agreement yet.  
Status Conference: 9/06/2022 at 2:00 PM (via Zoom)
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

(Case called at 8:33 AM)
Defendant David S. Dresel not in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared.  Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant in custody in Chippewa County, not transported.  Defendant has pending cases in Chippewa County as well as a revocation.  Attorney Thorson representing on Chippewa County matters, working on global resolution.
Status Conference:  August 15, 2022 at 3:30 pm.
Status conference on June 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:30 PM cases 21CM820 and 22CF33 called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David S. Dresel in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for David S. Dresel. Defense advises the defendant is being revoked from Probation in another county and asks for another status conference after June 2nd. 
A Status Conference is scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 8:30 AM.
Status conference on May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing on May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:45 AM cases 21CM820, 22CF33 called. Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David S. Dresel in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for David S. Dresel. 
In 22CF33: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the court. 30 days to file motions. 
In both files: A status conference is to be scheduled with the Branch 1 judicial assistant.
Arraignment on March 28, 2022 at 10:45 am.

(9:41 AM cases 21CM820, 22CF33 called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant David S. Dresel appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for David S. Dresel.
Defendant waives reading of Information in 22CF33 and enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts, which the Court does not accept due to the defendant's confusion regarding substitution of counsel.
Attorney Thorson is to schedule an Arraignment with Branch 1 Judicial Assistant.
Same as Complaint.
Arraignment on February 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Case called at 2:50 PM- by Zoom) Defendant David S. Dresel appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared in court for David S. Dresel, Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to personal appearance. State Calls Officer Sam Sperry, Eau Claire Police Department, Sworn and testifies. Court takes Judicial Notice of signed bond in Chippewa County case Cross-examination of Officer Sperry by Defense. Witness is excused. 
Court finds probable cause and binds matter over. Arraignment to be scheduled with Branch 1 Judicial Assistant.

records.addlTxt: SPD Appointment - Attorney Robert Thorson
Preliminary hearing on January 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

(Case called at 10:59 AM) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant David S. Dresel appeared by video, in custody in Eau Claire County Jail with Attorney Sonia L Anderson. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation. 
Preliminary Hearing: 01/25/2022 at 2:00 PM.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
